ทำไม Bitcoin traders ยังคงถือ Long ท่ามกลาง BTC ขาดทุนรายวัน 317 ล้านเหรียญ

Why Bitcoin traders remain long despite $317M in daily BTC losses

1d ago//Muriuki Lazaro
bitcoin
AI

Summary

TH

นักเทรด Bitcoin ยังคงถือตำแหน่ง Long อย่างหนาแน่น แม้ว่าความสูญเสียจริงจะขยายตัวจนเทียบเคียงระดับการยอมจำนน (capitulation) ในปลายปี 2022 ซึ่งบ่งชี้ว่ามีการทำลายมูลค่าและความเครียดต่องบดุลอย่างมาก แม้ว่า spot demand และความมั่นใจในตลาดจะอ่อนแอลง แต่ Long/Short Ratio โดยรวมกลับมีแนวโน้มเพิ่มสูงขึ้น เนื่องจากนักลงทุนแห่เข้าสู่ Bitcoin เพื่อความปลอดภัยโครงสร้างมากกว่า altcoins การ re-leveraging อย่างก้าวร้าวในช่วง downtrend นี้ได้เพิ่มความเสี่ยงขั้นระบบ เนื่องจากจุด liquidation ได้รวมตัวกันแน่นในระดับต่ำกว่าช่วงราคาปัจจุบัน โครงสร้างตลาดสะท้อนถึงการปฏิเสธความเสี่ยงในแง่ลบ ซึ่งหมายความว่าราคาที่ดิ่งลงเพียงเล็กน้อยก็อาจทำให้เกิด long squeezes และแรงกดดันในการขายแบบ capitulation เพิ่มขึ้นต่อเนื่อง

EN

Bitcoin traders continue to hold heavy long positions despite expanding realized losses that rival late-2022 capitulation levels, signaling significant value destruction and stress on market balance sheets. Although spot demand and market confidence are deteriorating, the aggregate Long/Short Ratio is trending higher, often exceeding 2.5–3.0, as investors crowd into Bitcoin for perceived structural safety over altcoins. This aggressive re-leveraging during a downtrend heightens systemic risk, as liquidation bands cluster tightly below current ranges. The market structure reflects a denial of downside risk, meaning that even modest price drawdowns could trigger cascading long squeezes and further capitulation pressure.

Key Points

  • Realized losses are expanding, approaching late-2022 capitulation extremes with daily prints exceeding $5 billion.
  • Traders are increasing long positions despite price weakness, with the Long/Short Ratio exceeding 2.5–3.0.
  • High leverage concentration and tight liquidation bands increase the risk of cascading long squeezes.
  • Market structure is weakening as investors exhibit risk denial and re-leverage into an active downtrend.

Article

Journalist Posted: February 5, 2026 Source: Glassnode/X Here’s why capitulation is deepening Profitability continues to reset as realized losses expand across distribution phases, reinforcing persistent sell-side pressure. Peak realized losses now approach prior cycle extremes, with single-day prints exceeding $5 billion, rivaling late-2022 capitulation levels. Source: Glassnode/X As these peaks emerge, market structure weakens, while confidence and spot demand deteriorate in parallel. Losses as a share of market cap are also rising, signaling broader value destruction rather than isolated holder distress. This matters because higher proportional losses amplify balance sheet stress across cohorts. Source: Glassnode/X The loss per coin moved is rising, indicating that coins are being transferred at steeper discounts relative to their cost basis. As this trend deepens, leverage continues to unwind, while options markets maintain elevated pricing for downside risk across near‑term maturities. Leverage crowding builds as Bitcoin long bias intensifies Long positioning is building across the market as the aggregate Long/Short Ratio trends higher, reflecting rising directional exposure. However, the increase was not gradual; instead, it formed through sharp, inconsistent spikes, signaling reactive rather than stable conviction. Bitcoin long demand remains dominant, with ratios often exceeding 2.5–3.0, while altcoin averages stay closer to 1.5–2.0. This divergence persists despite Bitcoin’s recent price weakness, highlighting that traders remain overweight on BTC for its perceived structural safety. Source: X At the same time, leverage concentration is thickening rather than dispersing, raising systemic liquidation sensitivity. As traders add longs into a weakening price structure, positioning reflects a denial of broader downside risk. Liquidation bands now cluster tightly below recent ranges, meaning modest drawdowns could trigger cascading long squeezes. Funding and Open Interest trends further suggest re-leveraging, not healthy deleveraging, within an active downtrend. In summary, traders are facing increasing pressure to sell, as they are heavily invested and at risk of losing more money. Final Thoughts Capitulation pressure is growing because the losses traders are experiencing are similar to those in previous downturns. Bitcoin-heavy long crowding persists despite deteriorating structure, heightening systemic liquidation risk as leverage rebuilds into an active downtrend.
